data.title: Aloft Kuala Lumpur Sentral, Malaysia [Master Thread]
data.meta_description: Marriott | Marriott Bonvoy - Aloft Kuala Lumpur Sentral, Malaysia [Master Thread] - Check in was painless and easy. Service was great, very friendly. Rooms: Well, it's an Aloft so the layout is identical to all the other ones I've stayed at. Amenities: They have an infinity pool and a cigar lounge on the roof. ^^^ Why
data.text:
Jan 14, 2019, 1:24 am

FlyerTalk Forums Expert How-Tos and Guides

Last edit by: margarita girl

Hotel email address: [email protected]

Aloft Kuala Lumpur Sentral, Malaysia [Master Thread]

Apr 22, 2013, 10:00 pm

Join Date: Apr 2005

Location: SFO

Programs: UA MM, SQ KrisFlyer, SPG/Marriott Titanium

Posts: 1,231

Check in was painless and easy. Service was great, very friendly.

Rooms: Well, it's an Aloft so the layout is identical to all the other ones I've stayed at.

Amenities: They have an infinity pool and a cigar lounge on the roof. ^^^

Why don't other Alofts have the same? No coin laundry here.

Access: it's on the same side of KL Sentral as the KLIA Ekspres. Coming from the train, just exit the building and turn right. It's the highrise that's kinked at an angle on the right.

Great for SPG hopping but if rates were equal, I'd stay at the LM instead. I got a rate of MYR 249 so I'm fine with that.

Apr 22, 2013, 11:51 pm

Join Date: Jan 2012

Location: HEL

Programs: SPG LTP, hotels, OWE, STE+, *G, Octopus

Posts: 5,810

Quote:

Originally Posted by abraxis

Rooms: Well, it's an Aloft so the layout is identical to all the other ones I've stayed at.

Ouch!

Quote:

Originally Posted by abraxis

Amenities: They have an infinity pool and a cigar lounge on the roof. ^^^

OK, sold!!

May 3, 2013, 1:53 pm

Join Date: Apr 2005

Location: SFO

Programs: UA MM, SQ KrisFlyer, SPG/Marriott Titanium

Posts: 1,231

Quote:

Originally Posted by kevino

Will it be easy to walk from the LM to the Aloft with luggage?

It's a bit of a hike, but it can be done. I did it. You basically walk through KL Sentral, go up the escalator, exit the building from the KLIA Expres side, turn right and walk to the end of the building, then cross the street on the left. I did it with two roller bags and a backpack.

Jun 22, 2013, 10:13 pm

Join Date: Jan 2005

Location: New Orleans, LA

Programs: Starwood Platinum, HH Gold

Posts: 133

We stayed at the aloft a few weeks ago on points. As a platinum, we were in a standard room on a high floor. As others have mentioned, they don't really do much for status, but you do get use of their breakfast buffet which was nice. Good location if you're going to travel to other places by train/bus, but not much else around... here's our full review.

FlyerTalk Evangelist

Join Date: Dec 2003

Location: Benicia, California, USA

Programs: AA PLT,AS,UA PP,J6,FB,EY,LH,SQ,HH Dmd,Hyatt Glbl,Marriott Plat,IHG Plat,Accor Gold

Posts: 10,845

Useful review, especially since I'll be staying there in two days. Thanks for posting it.

Jun 26, 2013, 12:15 pm

Join Date: Dec 2000

Location: bay area, ca

Programs: UA plat, , aa plat, marriott LT titanium

Posts: 4,856

I think the breakfast is instead of points for plat. - I was not offered comp breakfast as a plat and there really are NO benefits offered for status other than the points.

Jul 6, 2013, 9:37 pm

Join Date: Aug 2009

Programs: Marriot Bonvoy

Posts: 58

1st time checked-in the hotel yesterday. Asking for late check out this morning cos plan to have lunch at Hilton then come back and check out. Was told by the front desk guy the latest can give me is until 1pm. Seem no recognition for plat guest. I told the guy I m a platinum guest but he keep asking me what time is my flight.(4pm late checkout should be no problem if the room available, in other starwood property in kl, they are not even asking and automatically put check out time 4pm) Feeling he is not friendly even though finally he agreed to give me late check-out. I passed him a car park ticket to validate cos we would like to go out and he told me he will charge me again for the car park cos today is consider 2nd day. I have question mark in my mind, i stay for one night, don't the parking rate for house guest is charged by 24 hours then consider per day? He told me 2nd day consider fresh day. I was not happy but I don't want to waste my time to argue with this small amount. Breakfast experience also not very happy. i was putting in a same table with another guest by different waiters. when i took my food and sitting the another guest came and told me he was putting to the same table as well. Finally a waiter solved it by arranging him to another table. A not very good experience this morning. I wish to complain but all staffs don't have name tag at all!! As for plat member, I don't really recommend to stay here. Try once before then you will know how to choose.

Jul 7, 2013, 9:18 am

Join Date: Apr 2006

Programs: Hyatt Globalist, Lifetime Bonvoy Platinum, HHonors Gold , TK Gold, MH Plat, QR Plat

Posts: 100

Quote:

Originally Posted by angeline77

Was told by the front desk guy the latest can give me is until 1pm. Seem no recognition for plat guest. I told the guy I m a platinum guest but he keep asking me what time is my flight.(4pm late checkout should be no problem if the room available, in other starwood property in kl, they are not even asking and automatically put check out time 4pm) Feeling he is not friendly even though finally he agreed to give me late check-out. I have question mark in my mind, i stay for one night, don't the parking rate for house guest is charged by 24 hours then consider per day? He told me 2nd day consider fresh day. I was not happy but I don't want to waste my time to argue with this small amount. Breakfast experience also not very happy. i was putting in a same table with another guest by different waiters. when i took my food and sitting the another guest came and told me he was putting to the same table as well. Finally a waiter solved it by arranging him to another table. A not very good experience this morning. I wish to complain but all staffs don't have name tag at all!! As for plat member, I don't really recommend to stay here. Try once before then you will know how to choose.

Wow, I have stayed in both the Le Meridien and Sheraton in KL...and even other hotels...never ever has one charged for '2 days parking' when staying for one night! That is absolutely ridiculous! So, is a guest supposed to come in and park after 12am?

I am surprised they don't 'honor' 4pm late checkouts- it's practically a right for a Plat to be given 4pm...The staff at Sheraton was actually disappointed I checked out at 11am

Looks like I'm sticking to the Sheraton next round!

They also tried to charge me a 2nd time on a 1 night stay and I told them off. Eventually they decided not to charge me. It should be for 24 hours.. It's ridiculous.

Oct 29, 2013, 8:19 am

Join Date: Apr 2005

Location: SFO

Programs: UA MM, SQ KrisFlyer, SPG/Marriott Titanium

Posts: 1,231

Am back at the Aloft KL Sentral.

Plat status recognized; placed in high room on 18th Floor. Checkin was quick and painless.

Proactive service, porter saw me coming bags and was quick to assist. Sent bags up to room, no problemo.

Got breakfast included, hopefully bonus points will post.

Aloft has become an "it" spot here. Walked into a fashion show on 2 as well as a 21st birthday party in the Cigar Lounge. Enthusiasm among the staff contagious. Found myself smiling after a day that began by leaving the Park Hyatt Shanghai at 0600.

Nov 3, 2013, 7:19 pm

Join Date: Jan 2012

Location: San Juan, PR

Programs: MR AMB/LT, AA EP, TK EP, DL D, B6 M4, F9 100K, IHG AMB/D, HH D, CZR D, FndCd, Sixt D, NTL E, Hz PC

Posts: 432

I stayed here in October 2013; really quite nice, although I think for Platinums the lack of a club lounge and potential upgrades could make other Starwood choices better.

Had a high floor; room was Aloft standard and great. Staff were particularly good (I'd just done a week at the Inter-Continental KL for a conference; nicer room and all there since it is a 3x more expensive hotel, but I'd take the Aloft staff anyday).

Great cash rates, but even better points. Ended up having a $10 great buffet dinner (50% off for Starwood members) as well as breakfast. Essentially Bangkok-Starwood quality.

Toss up on here and the LeM for location. I still really like the Sheraton Imperial and Westin due to upgrades, though.

Jan 26, 2014, 2:48 am

Join Date: Mar 2010

Location: Europe/SEA

Programs: TK E+, Bonvoy LT Plat, Hilton Diamond, IHG Platinum, Dusit Gold

Posts: 1,715

Aloft Kuala Lumpur Sentral , Malaysia, opened March 22, 2013 [Master Thread]

The rooms here are a joke, aloft bkk smaller but much nicer. Staff is friendly and very "talented" though. Rooftop bar is great. Restaurant brought us cold food... complained and chef came to apologise, got new food cooked and didn't have to pay. Restaurant also tried to sell drinking water as mineral water, complained and received aqua panna.

Walking distance to kl sentral checkin facilities is great. Wouldn't stay here again, room setting make me freak out. Méridien much better value ( awesome pool/ breakfast/ lounge ).

Jan 26, 2014, 3:18 am

Suspended

Join Date: Dec 2001

Location: SEA(sia)

Posts: 5,181

Quote:

Originally Posted by cln

aloft bkk smaller but much nicer.

I don't think Aloft BKK rooms are smaller but its certainly nicer. On the other hand, Aloft KL common areas like lobby, f&b venues etc and the building facade doesn't feel as low end as BKK.

aloft bkk standard room is 3sqm smaller.

aloft kl has 33sqm / bkk 30sqm for loft room type.
